result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keith Allen Stevens

defendant.name: Stevens, Keith Allen
defendant.address: 13858 W Agency Rd, Stone Lake, WI 54843

records.addlTxt: Atty Forseth indicates DEF waives preliminary hearing.  Court advised the DEF as to his right to prelim.  DEF does not wish to have prelim.  Court finds defendant freely waived his right to prelim finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

11:11 AM Defendant Keith Allen Stevens appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Robert N Forseth appeared by video for Keith Allen Stevens.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Forseth make bond modification argument.  State makes request to modify bond.   Court modifies bond CBS $5000 with same conditions.    DEF choses to speak,  Attny Forseth requests DEF not to speak.   DEF indicates treatment in the works, Court indicates bond could possibly be amended for treatment, and to work with attorney on details.  
 DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  Through Attorney Forseth  enters NG Plea to Count 6.    Attny Forseth indicates DEF waives preliminary hearing.
Arraignment scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

8:45 AM Defendant Keith A Stevens appeared by video from the Sawyer County Jail. Attorney Kenneth Sortedahl appears for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Court reviews court record. State addresses the court and the status of the case, court discussion follows. Court addresses the DEF. DEF qualifies for the public defender. Court sets a new hearing date.
Hearing scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Bail/bond hearing on October 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:29 AM DE Keith Stevens in court, appearing in custody by video from the Sawyer County Jail, with Atty Alsyja Otten (special appearance) by video. Bruce R Poquette appeared in person for the State of WI.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  DE verifies DOB and Address.  Attny Otten indicates DEF refused the PD services, unknown qualifications for public defender.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty Otten no response.  DEF makes statement to court.  Court sets bond.   Court gives the DE the attorney colloquy. Court sets INITIAL APPEARANCE for 11/1/2022 at 8:30AM.
